heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 20 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (177°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 54.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) and inside temperature (down 1.7°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 762 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 2.4m lower than yesterday, 471.1m lower than the past week, 762.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 642m to a maximum of 993m, averaging 752.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1223.6m and 1514.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and the light is absent. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
